reviewText: This is an awesome play with an awesome message! It is okay if some of the same actors were not in this play, it is good to see new faces.. Fresh faces and story lines.Messages that inspire and touch and heal the soul! This play has that and more!We enjoy all of Tyler Perry's plays and we have been a fan for years! This is an exceptional play that is refreshing and right on time.This is the season for such a message! This play delivers and gives insight on a much needed subject matter in these times. This play also has humor and will have you rolling on the floor laughing!This play has so many profound statements and wonderful food for thought.We own all of Tyler Perry's plays, book, and movies that are out on DVD, even Alex Cross which was and is a great movie! And we will be viewing Temptation confessions of a marriage counselor this weekend!We are so happy to hear that Tyler Perry will have his own Network soon! I pray that his network will be aired on regular T.V., everyone does not have cable and regular T.V. will make a great impact and is in need of inspiration, positive shows that Tyler Perry produces.. To God Be The Glory!Keep them coming! We love clean family, inspirational movies and plays!Bring Clean, good moral T.V Back! Thank you Tyler Perry for all you do! You are a true Blessing!

reviewText: A creative list of ingredients that make up I Don't Want to Do Wrong:A dash of lyrical genius and impeccable musical talent (SERIOUSLY!!!!!!)1/4 cup of salt and 1 cup of water for all the tears (REAL TEARS!!!!)1 hollow brain with the voice of an angel1 scarred soul and hopeless romantic3 cups of spices, spunk and attitude4 strong, forgiving hearts2 tablespoons of laughterBake for one hour and forty-five minutes! You will most certainly enjoy more than one serving of this play! Matter of fact, I think I'll watch it again tomorrow... or right now! IT'S THAT GOOD!
summary: Could this be Tyler Perry's best play ever!?

reviewText: After purchasing Tyler Perry's last playTyler Perry's Aunt Bam's Place - The Play, I'll admit I was quite disappointed.  Tyler Perry has released many plays and films and while they all possess superbly inspiring and ultimately heartwarming messages, sometimes the plot can be narrow.  Aunt Bam's Place failed to have the 'oomph' that so many of Terry's plays do, even with its comedic relief; a lack of 'Madea' certainly hampered it.  'Madea' is absent in the newly releasedTyler Perry's I Don't Want to Do Wrong - The Play, but the plot is more unified than that of Aunt Bam's House.  Add the funny and popular Palmer Williams as well as Patrice Lovely, and the comical presence that lacked some in Aunt Bam's House is atoned for.The overall theme of I Don't Want to Do Wrong is adultery in a long distance marriage. The adultery comes to head and things become a complete mess which requires much prayer, patching up, and forgiveness.  As with the majority of Perry's plays, it ends happily, though if there were a quibble as to the realistic nature, the play could've ended oppositely and perhaps represented the more 'realist' view.  Other than an over-optimistic ending, the other rub might be the musical selections.  Sometimes the songs come off as flat (in general) in Perry's plays and are more annoying than inspirational as they are slated to be.  The songs tend to be 'big' ballads slated in soul/gospel sensibilities, but sometimes don't pack the punch until they are almost finished.Overall, I Don't Want To Do Wrong is one of Perry's better plays.  It avoids the missteps that disappointed in Aunt Bam's House, while coming close to rivaling non 'Madea' themed plays such asThe Marriage Counselor (The Play)orTyler Perry's Why Did I Get Married - The Play.  It doesn't reach the highs of sayTyler Perry's Meet the Browns: The PlayorTyler Perry's What's Done in the Dark - The Play, but it is solid.
summary: Marked Improvement Over Aunt Bam's House - 3  Stars

reviewText: This was another  master piece, Tyler Perry did it again. I love how Tyler Perry believes in giving others a chance and once he discovers a persons gifts and talents he continues to use them and God allows  their gifts to continue to make room for them. Mr. Palmer killed it, he is multi-talented and he really allowed God to really use him and you can fell the ANOINTING ministring through the singing, praying, and acting.The whole cast was extra-ordinary and deserve a standing ovation for a job well done. I love the whole play but the ending was by far superb, the HOLY SPIRIT SHOWED UP AND SHOWED OUT!!! This play delivered the message that Tyler Perry was driving home, I will not spoil it for any one by giving away any information you must go out and purchase it for your self and see how GOD was speaking.
summary: Honesty Is Always The Best Policy!
